title: China Exports Censorship Techniques
description: The human rights group Freedom House reports that countries are embracing China’s model of digital authoritarianism.

title: Threats to Press Freedom in Asia in 2018
description: Reporters across Asia faced imprisonment and violence over the past year as they sought to cover the news.

title: Foreign Journalists in China: Working Conditions Deteriorating
Internet Shutdowns Mushroom Across Africa
description: Something lorem ipsum color could go here and hereg also lorem ipsum dolor aqui y aqui.

title: Activists Push Back on Social Media Restrictions
description: During recent anti-government protests, the public received information through social media and now the government wants a law to block such platforms.

title: US 'Concerned' Iran’s Intranet Project Will Repress Internet Freedom
description: The Trump administration has expressed concern about reports that Iranian authorities have made progress in developing a domestic intranet and firewall system to shield Iran from the global internet.
alt: Iranians surf the internet at a cafe in Tehran, Iran.

title: How Philippine President's Rising Anger Led to an Editor’s Arrest for Cyber-Libel
description: lorem ipsum short description goes here and here and here.

title: Arrest of Journalist Maria Ressa Casts Pall on Journalistic Independence
description: Ressa, a frequent critic of the policies of Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte, has repeatedly been charged with infractions, such as tax evasion.

title: Burundi Extends Bans on VOA, BBC, Deepening Media Crackdown
description: The ban is indefinite and extends to journalists, both foreign and domestic, who provide information to either broadcaster.

title: ‘We are not criminals or electronic dissidents’
description: Report on three Algerian journalists that were arrested by the government and the growing concerns of digital media outlets in Algeria.

title: Ennahda Party sues journalists; Journalists’ Union rejects intimidation
description: The Ennahda Movement’s decision to take legal action against journalists and the local media has sparked controversy in Tunisia.

title: A Personal Journey of Press Freedom in Ethiopia
description: In a trajectory apart from autocratic trends in Africa, the new Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed is lifting restrictions on the media and freeing detained bloggers and journalists. Websites and TV stations that had been blocked are coming back. After 40 years, Voice of America’s Africa director, Negussie Mengesha returns to his homeland.
alt: VOA’s Africa director Negussie Mengesha walks through a cemetary during his first trip home to Ethiopia in 40 years.

title: Uyghur reporters describe family members’ detentions
description: In “The Families Left Behind” six Radio Free Asia reporters tell the stories of their family members’ detention and document human rights abuses in northwestern China.
alt: Protestors hold up signs to raise awareness about the treatment of Uyghurs in northwest China.

title: Rise and Fall of Free Media in Siberia
description: TV2 in Tomsk, Siberia, was among the last free and independent regional media outlets in Russia. But the company's unfettered journalism was not in sync with the country's increasingly restrictive political climate.
alt: The TV2 sign in Tomsk, Siberia is removed from the top of the studio after the station is shut down.

title: Lasting Damage After Cambodia's Wave of Press Oppression
description: Nearly a year after the election, the wave of oppression may have subsided, but the damage to the country’s democratic structures is clearly visible.
alt: Two former Radio Free Asia reporters Uon Chhin, center, and Yeang Socheamet, right, hold together as they walk outside the main prison of Prey Sar at the outskirt of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, Aug. 21, 2018.

title: After Two Years, Journalist Stanislav Aseyev Remains Captive In Donbas
description: In the spring of 2017, RFE/RL contributor Stanislav Aseyev was allegedly abducted by Russia-backed separatists while reporting from the conflict zone in eastern Ukraine. Two years later, he is still being held. His only opportunity to communicate with the outside world was when he appeared in handcuffs on Russian state-run TV and said he had been accused of espionage.

title: Russia Adds RFE/RL Contributor To ‘Extremist’ List
description: Russia’s Federal Financial Monitoring Service has added Pskov-based journalist and Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty Russian Service contributor Svetlana Prokopyeva to its list of terrorists and extremist

title: Covering the News While in Self-Exile
description: Leticia Gaitán left her 2-year-old child and family behind, joining an exodus of some 50 Nicaraguan journalists who fled the country amid the crackdown’s grim climate of fear and intimidation.
alt: A scene from taping the news program Nicaragua Actual
